list.title: AtomSelectionSpec
list.description:
Atom selection object. Used to specify what atoms should be selected. Can include
any field from {@link AtomSpec} in which case atoms must equal the specified value.
All fields must match for the selection to hold. If values
are provided as a list, then only one value of the list must match.

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#and
list.description: take the intersection of the provided lists of {@link AtomSelectionSpec}s

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#bonds
list.description: overloaded to select number of bonds, e.g. {bonds: 0} will select all nonbonded atoms

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#byres
list.description: if set, expands the selection to include all atoms of any residue that has any atom selected

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#expand
list.description: expands the selection to include all atoms within a given distance from the selection

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#frame
list.description: frame index of individual frame to style; will apply to all frames if not set

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#index
list.description: index of the atom or atoms to select

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#invert
list.description: if set, inverts the meaning of the selection

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#model
list.description: a single model or list of models from which atoms should be selected. Can also specify by numerical creation order. Reverse indexing is allowed (-1 specifies last added model).

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#not
list.description: take the inverse of the provided {@link AtomSelectionSpec}

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#or
list.description: take the union of the provided lists of {@link AtomSelectionSpec}s

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#predicate
list.description: user supplied function that gets passed an {@link AtomSpec} and should return true if the atom should be selected

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#resi
list.description: overloaded to allow ranges and lists of residues, e.g. {resi: "5-10"} or {resi: [5,10,32]}

list.title: AtomSelectionSpec#within
list.description: intersects the selection with the set of atoms within a given distance from another selection

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec
list.description:
A visualization of protein or nucleic acid secondary structure. Applying this to other molecules will not show anything.
In nucleic acids, the base cylinders obtain their color from the atom to which the cylinder is drawn, which is 'N1' for purines (resn: 'A', 'G', 'DA', 'DG') and
'N3' for pyrimidines (resn: 'C', 'U', 'DC', 'DT').
The different nucleobases can therefore be distinguished as by setting the colors
of each of these atoms. The backbone color is set from the 'P' atoms ('O5' for the 5' terminus).

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#arrows
list.description:
whether to add arrows showing beta-sheet
directionality; does not apply to trace or ribbon

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#color
list.description: strand color, may specify as 'spectrum' which will apply reversed gradient based on residue number

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#colorfunc
list.description: Allows the user to provide a function for setting the colorschemes.

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#colorscheme
list.description: colorscheme to use on atoms; overrides color

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#gapcutoff
list.description:
If there is a gap of strictly fewer than gapcutoff missing residues
within a chain, draw a dashed line.

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#hidden
list.description: do not show

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#opacity
list.description:
set opacity from 0-1; transparency is set per-chain
with a warning outputted in the event of ambiguity

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#ribbon
list.description:
whether to use constant strand width, disregarding
secondary structure; use thickness to adjust radius

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#style
list.description: style of cartoon rendering (trace, oval, rectangle (default), parabola, edged)

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#thickness
list.description: cartoon strand thickness, default is 0.4

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#tubes
list.description:
whether to display alpha helices as simple cylinders;
does not apply to trace

list.title: CartoonStyleSpec#width
list.description:
cartoon strand width, default is secondary
structure-dependent; does not apply to trace or ribbon

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec
list.description: Parser options specification. Used to specify the options of a GLModel. Depending on the input file format, not all fields may be defined.

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#altLoc
list.description: which alternate location to select, if present; '*' to load all ; supported by pdb

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#assemblyIndex
list.description: index of the assembly in symmetry ; supported by mmtf

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#assignBonds
list.description: for formats without explicit bonds (e.g. PDB, xyz) infer bonding (default true).

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#doAssembly
list.description: boolean dictating weather or not to do assembly ; supported by mcif, pdb

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#dontConnectDuplicatedAtoms
list.description: do not detect bonds between symmetries generated with duplicateAssemblyAtoms (cif only - other formats never make bonds between symmetries)

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#duplicateAssemblyAtoms
list.description: Set to true if you wish to duplicate assembly atoms otherwise false ; supported by all formats with symmetries. Not duplicating will result in faster rendering but it will not be possible to individually style symmetries.

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#frames
list.description: true if you want to add to a new frame and false otherwise ; supported by all

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#hbondCutoff
list.description: maximum distance used for identifying hydrogen bonds when computing secondary structure; supported by pdb, mmtf, cif

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#keepH
list.description: do not strip hydrogens ; supported by sdf,mol2

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#multimodel
list.description: specifies whether or not multiple models are being defined ; supported by xyz,sdf, or mol2

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#noComputeSecondaryStructure
list.description: do not compute ss ; supported by pdb, mmtf, cif

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#noSecondaryStructure
list.description: boolean dictating the presence of a secondary structure ; supported by pdb

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#normalizeAssembly
list.description: shift symmetry mates so their centroid is in the unit cell

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#onemol
list.description: specifies weather or not the model is of one molecule ; Supported by xyz , sdf , mol2

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#parseStyle
list.description: used to define ChemDoodle styles ; supported by cdjson

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#style
list.description: set model to this style after parsing

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#unboundCations
list.description: for formats without explicit bonds, if assigning bonds to not assign bonds to common cations

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#vibrate
list.description: object specifying the vibration behavior ; supported by all

list.title: ParserOptionsSpec#wrapAtoms
list.description: Set to true with duplicateAssemblyAtoms to individually wrap atoms (from symmetries) into unit cell

The default 3Dmol.js handlers are available for use:
'mousedown touchstart': viewer._handleMouseDown,
'DOMMouseScroll mousewheel': viewer._handleMouseScroll
'mousemove touchmove': viewer._handleMouseMove

list.title: WithinSelectionSpec
list.description:
Within selection object. Used to find the subset of an atom selection that is within
some distance from another atom selection. When added as a field of an {@link AtomSelectionSpec},
intersects the set of atoms in that selection with the set of atoms within a given
distance from the given {@link AtomSelectionSpec}.

list.title: WithinSelectionSpec#distance
list.description: the distance in angstroms away from the atom selection to include atoms in the parent selection

list.title: WithinSelectionSpec#invert
list.description: if set, selects atoms not within distance range for intersection

list.title: WithinSelectionSpec#sel
list.description: the selection of atoms against which to measure the distance from the parent atom selection
